result.execSummary:
The defendant John M Whyte was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant John M Whyte in court with attorney Brian William Severson.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Rights/Elements, Court in recess at 3:49 P.M., case recalled at 4:07 P.M., appearances the same, Defendant pleads no contest to Ct. 1, Judgment to be entered, Court sentences defendant to: $579.00 fine/costs, due in 60 days or payment plan, defendant to submit DNA Sample, DNA Sample, to be done by 4:30 P.M. on Monday, August, 22, 2016
